inclusion.criterion: Advanced chronic heart failure (HF) will be defined as left ventricular ejection fraction less than 35%, creatinine less than 2 mg/dL, and CHF NY functional class III-IV for more than 3 months.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Enrolled patients should be admitted to hospital due to heart failure requiring adjustment of inotropic agents or diuretics within recent 6 months.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: presence of mitral stenosis or prosthetic mitral valve
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: any abnormality of atrial septum (e.g., atrial septal defect or aneurysm)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
